meanings.definition: To measure or determine the extent, dimensions, or quantity of something.
meanings.sent1: She was admeasuring the room to see if the new furniture would fit.
meanings.sent2: The tailor admeasured the fabric before cutting it for the dress.
meanings.sent3: The curious cat admeasured the box before deciding to jump in.
meanings.sent4: His eyes admeasured the vast ocean before him, trying to comprehend its size.
meanings.sent5: The scientist admeasuring the liquid in the beaker with precision.

meanings.definition: To assess or estimate the size or amount of something.
meanings.sent1: The farmer admeasured the field to determine how much seed he needed.
meanings.sent2: The real estate agent admeasured the property before listing it for sale.
meanings.sent3: The child admeasured the pile of candies, trying to guess how many were there.
meanings.sent4: Her heart admeasured the love in his eyes, feeling its depth.
meanings.sent5: The teacher admeasuring the time each student took to complete the test.
